meanings.definition: In a manner that appeals to the emotions and prejudices of the people.
meanings.sent1: The politician demagogically stirred up fear among the crowd.
meanings.sent2: She spoke demagogically to win over the audience.
meanings.sent3: The comedian demagogically joked about aliens invading Earth.
meanings.sent4: His speech demagogically painted a picture of chaos and uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain demagogically manipulating the townspeople.

meanings.definition: Using tactics characteristic of a demagogue.
meanings.sent1: The demagogically charged speech riled up the crowd.
meanings.sent2: Her demagogically persuasive techniques were effective in swaying opinions.
meanings.sent3: The demagogically dressed man stood out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The demagogically crafted message struck a chord with the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The demagogically inclined leader knew how to incite passion in his followers.
